content: Really nice idea, why not add shortest and reverse mode?

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very fun clash :)

Simple Rock/paper/scissors with the slight twist of multiple in a row.
Adds a simple change to a simple game for a fun clash.
Ty for adding the test case <3

Good clash. Slight suggestion:

There isn't a test case visible to the clasher that goes from Fire -> Grass.
In the event their code doesn't account  for Fire -> Grass, the test cases will all check out, but they'll fail due to validator 4.

Validator 4 is the only instance of going from Fire to Grass in a way that effects the end result.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice problem about iteration, with a cool theme

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good one

BTW, a fun trick to write function winner(a,b) without writing out too many cases explicitly:

def winner(a,b):
    a,b = sorted((a,b))
    return b if (a,b)==('Fire','Water') else a

I suggest adding the following testcase before Random 50:

Fire Water Fire Grass (Winner: Grass)

My motivation for this test is that if we use a FIFO queue instead of a LIFO stack (ie, if we make the winner move to the right instead of staying on the left), then the small testcases you have already written all pass, and Random 50 is the first testcase to fail. I think it might be good to have a small testcase that can show the difference between queue and stack.

Stub generator
* Please change Line 2 to: "loopline N type:word(5)".

Thanks.
Thanks, I have added this test case and a validator.
Do you have other approval reasons than "Good one"? ðŸ˜…

Hello, Fire -> Grass is the first matchup of Random 50 and Random 100. So you cannot forget about it.

Even if it doesn't affect the end result, people who code the wrong winner for that matchup should naturally fail one of the hidden cases. I don't think it's necessary to have a visible test case that accounts for every single matchup.

That being said I can easily make another visible test where the last match is Fire vs Grass.

- I personally would not like to get this task on shortest mode.
- It is impossible to figure out the solution in reverse mode.
Sorry, yeah the only reason I mentioned it is because I coded a solution and made a silly goof where I didn't account for fire -> grass, so I completed every case except validator 4

It's true that I'm not very descriptive, it bores me a bit to always be describing. ðŸ˜…

As for this clash, I think it's great because it's a little exercise in "scissors leaf stone" that's quite similar to some easy puzzles while still adding its own unique touch. The iteration system coupled with the triangular mechanics make for a clash that's complex enough to be entertaining without being too complex or too heavy to read or done. And I have to admit that I really enjoyed the pokemon version of the "scissors leaf stone". The description was very clear and well structured so that it was easy to understand and read at a glance: handy for the chosen speed mode. It would have been interesting to put it in codegolf but personally I'm bored of codegolf clashes with some "identities" in. The test suite isn't detailed enough to allow a reverse but it's more than enough to cover all the problem cases. So I think it's a "Good one".
Having personally read and seen no problems, I trusted your sharp eye for formatting issues.
